hints.title: N-Uniform Logarithmic Sobolev Inequality
hints.content:
1759: :label: cor-n-uniform-lsi
1760: 
1761: Under the same conditions as Theorem {prf:ref}`thm-main-kl-convergence`, the LSI constant for the N-particle Euclidean Gas is **uniform in N**. That is, there exists a constant $C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max} < \infty$ such that:
1762: 
1763: $$
1764: \sup_{N \geq 2} C_{\text{LSI}}(N) \leq C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max}
1765: $$
1766: 
1767: **Explicit bound**:
1768: 
1769: $$
1770: C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max} = O\left(\frac{1}{\min(\gamma, \kappa_{\text{conf}}) \cdot \kappa_{W,\min} \cdot \delta^2}\right)
1771: $$

hints.content:
1775: 
1776: :::{prf:proof}
1777: **Proof.**
1778: 
1779: 1. From Corollary {prf:ref}`cor-quantitative-lsi-final` (Section 5.6), the LSI constant for the N-particle system is given by:
1780:    $$
1781:    C_{\text{LSI}}(N) = O\left(\frac{1}{\min(\gamma, \kappa_{\text{conf}}) \cdot \kappa_W(N) \cdot \delta^2}\right)
1782:    $$
1783: 
1784: 2. The parameters $\gamma$ (friction coefficient) and $\kappa_{\text{conf}}$ (confining potential convexity) are N-independent by definition (algorithm parameters).
1785: 
1786: 3. From **Theorem 2.3.1** of [04_convergence.md](../04_convergence.md) (Inter-Swarm Error Contraction Under Kinetic Operator), the Wasserstein contraction rate $\kappa_W(N)$ is proven to be **N-uniform**. Specifically, the theorem states:
1787: 
1788:    > **Key Properties:**
1789:    > 3. **N-uniformity:** All constants are independent of swarm size N.
1790: 
1791:    Therefore, there exists $\kappa_{W,\min} > 0$ such that $\kappa_W(N) \geq \kappa_{W,\min}$ for all $N \geq 2$.
1792: 
1793: 4. The cloning noise parameter $\delta > 0$ is an algorithm parameter, independent of $N$.
1794: 
1795: 5. Therefore, the LSI constant is uniformly bounded:
1796:    $$
1797:    C_{\text{LSI}}(N) \leq O\left(\frac{1}{\min(\gamma, \kappa_{\text{conf}}) \cdot \kappa_{W,\min} \cdot \delta^2}\right) =: C_{\text{LSI}}^{\max} < \infty
1798:    $$
